intro: Heliosperma pusillum var. lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf heliosperma, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lanceolate, which helps reduce water loss in dry conditions. The flowers are usually pale yellow or white and bloom in late spring or early summer.
